meanings.sent1: The baby's soft skin felt talcumed after the bath.
meanings.sent2: She bought talcumed socks to keep her feet dry.
meanings.sent3: The talcumed puppy left a trail of white paw prints on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The talcumed clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: The talcumed petals of the flower shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To apply talcum powder to something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully talcumed her hands before putting on the gloves.
meanings.sent2: He always talcumed his shoes to prevent odor.
meanings.sent3: The magician talcumed his assistant before the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She talcumed the baby's bottom to keep it dry and rash-free.
meanings.sent5: The athlete talcumed his body before the race to reduce friction.
